title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of coin using variables. The number of nickels is three more than eight times the number of pennies, so you can represent nickels as $$8p+3$$, and write pennies simply as p.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiple the number of each coin type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their coin values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{0.05}\left(8p+3\right)+0.01p=3.02$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug p into the original relationship between the coins to find $$8p+3$$.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 59 nickels and 7 pennies.
